text: @Gkabui You also declare that you break all curses, spiritual attachments & evil assignments against you by the authority & power of Christ.
@Gkabui You thank Holy Spirit for what He's done  & invite Him to remove any unclean spirits that might've tried to cling to each of you.
The great adventure of prayer is even more thrilling when shared with others. We are more than conquerors through Christ! Enjoy the journey!
When waging spiritual warfare prayer, remember Jesus already won the war on the cross, you're just doing mop-up operations. Don’t be afraid.
When waging spiritual battle in prayer, enemy spirits often try to cling to intercessors, so be sure to pray-wash each other off afterward.
@iWork4HimRadio Welcome to Twitter!  Let's talk soon about strategy to build your presence and avoid a negative witness. Love you!
When teaching others about prayer, don't forget to pray together!  Practice is the best part!
Prayer is not a stoic exercise. It's OK to laugh along the way ... or cry ... or both at the same time. Real relationships engage emotions!
When you minister in prayer, you're getting to go to work with your Dad! It's exciting to see your Father in action! Enjoy the partnership!
In Christ I am God’s masterpiece! He has created me anew in Christ Jesus, so I can do the good things He planned for me long ago!  Eph. 2:10
In Christ, I can do all things through Him who gives me strength! (Philippians 4:13). #declarationprayer
In Christ, I have the peace of God which transcends all understanding and guards my heart and my mind in Christ Jesus. (Philippians 4:7)
Partner with the Holy Spirit to transform your life! Declare back to God in prayer that you're who God’s word declares you to be in Christ!
@VivianRuthSawye "Loving on" is more active & intentional. Sometimes we need to be reminded what it feels like to be loved & appreciated.
When you pray with someone, take time to love on God together! Be sure to let God love on you too! It's the most wonderful kind of prayer!
When praying together with someone, take time to celebrate what God's done while you're praying & keep celebrating God's ongoing work after.
Scripture tells us the intention of the Father and the Spirit is to glorify Christ. Pray with that intent in mind. Pray to glorify Christ!
Praise Jesus, the Righteous Branch of David, who has restored the throne of David and established his kingdom forever!
Praise Jesus, Hope of the Nations! Nations will come to his light, and kings to the brightness of his dawn!
Praise Jesus, the Hope of Israel, in the majesty of the name of the LORD Our God, He has established righteousness and justice in the land!
Praise Jesus, the Firstfruit of the Resurrection of the Dead, who has given us new birth into a living hope through His resurrection!
There is power in the name of Jesus! Learn to pray using each of His names and titles to expand your faith in who He is and what He can do!
Always pray in Christ! Remember it's your position in Christ that gives you access to God's throne room. Abide in Him! John 15:7
John 15:7 If you abide (dwell, live and remain) in me and my words abide in you, you may ask for anything you want, and it will be granted!
Always pray in the Spirit! Pray in the Spirit humbly led, guided, prompted and empowered by the Spirit in your own language or in tongues .
Intercession can be exhausting. Rely on God's strength. Let God refresh you. Ultimately even the praying is up to God not just the response.
When God prompts you to pray for someone do it immediately! If they're present do it with them if they're open. Their life may depend on it!
Jesus is Lord, you are not. Never boss God as you minister in prayer or put yourself in the position of demanding that God do anything.
As you minister in prayer get excited with God! Share in His joy and cheer Him on! Invite God to do more! BUT don't shout orders at God.
…afterwards share with them what you prayed & what you heard God say or saw God do as you prayed. It helps them become more sensitive to God
Discipleship exercise: Pray silently over someone, then ask afterward what they understood God was doing and saying while you were praying.…
One way to teach listening prayer is have them pray over you & correct & guide them if they go off course or hesitate to speak what God says
When teaching others to minister in prayer, observe them as they pray and don't be afraid to correct and guide them if they go off course.
As you pray invite God to open your eyes, ears & heart to perceive what He's doing so you can agree with Him in prayer & join Him in action!
If the wind of the Spirit starts to blow as you pray, allow Him to set your course and drive you forward until you reach His destination!
Prayer together doesn’t always have to be serious & somber. Celebrate what God's doing! Enjoy God & each other! Laugh with God & each other!
Amen doesn't mean “The end.” It means “May it be so!” Don't stop praying until God releases you to stop! "In Jesus's name, May it be so!"
When you're discipling someone, use part of your prayer time together to teach them how to hear God's voice and to model how to pray boldly!
When others pray over you take time to pray over them too! God may have sent them for their benefit too not just yours! Complete the circle!
Amen doesn't mean “The end!” It means “It's a faithful & true saying!” or “May it be so!” Don't stop praying until God releases you to stop!
In Christ, I am more than a conqueror through Him Who loves me! (Romans 8:37)
In Christ, I have God-sized peace. In this world I will have trouble. But I can take heart because Jesus has overcome the world. John 16:33
In Christ I have been given His peace. I will not let my heart be troubled or be afraid. (John 14:27)
Partner with the Holy Spirit to transform your life! Declare back to God in prayer that you're who God’s word declares you to be in Christ!
Praise Jesus, Our Risen and Exalted Lord! God the Father put Him in the place of highest honor at His right hand as LORD and Savior!
Praise Jesus, God's Holy and Anointed One, Lion of the Tribe of Judah, the Bright and Morning Star, the Root of David, has won the victory!
Praise Jesus, the Prince of Peace, who rules with justice and righteousness; of the increase of his government & peace there will be no end!
There is power in the name of Jesus! Learn to pray using each of His names and titles to expand your faith in who He is and what He can do!
Let's keep our focus on God our Father, rather than on those behind the tragedy of the present hour. https://t.co/QdmFBXtBOR
When praying with others pray conversationally. Don't dominate the conversation. Listen to God. Encourage others to pray as He prompts them.
Adding my prayers, for Paris.  Please add yours. https://t.co/grFHwAtwLd
When praying with & for others, invite God to use your senses to prompt & guide your prayers. Be sensitive to His direction & quick to obey!
When praying with and for others, practice praying with your eyes open. Pause to listen. Be fully alert to what God is doing!
When praying with and for others, let God set the direction and agenda, not the clock. Don't stop until God releases you to stop praying.
Pray conversationally when praying with others. Don't dominate the conversation. Let others pray in concert. Let God talk too. No preaching!
Prayer is intimate, be cautious! Don't let yourself become inappropriately attached to the person you are praying with. Pray in plain sight.
If asked to pray for someone, pray on the spot and as often as prompted afterward. Don't just promise to pray. PRAY! Nothing is more urgent!
Grow your faith by reciting God's mighty works as you pray. It will help you trust God for new mighty works in your own life and time.
One of the powerful prayers of the early church is Kyrie eleison! Christe eleison! Eleison!  Lord have mercy! Christ have mercy! Have mercy!
When God's people pray together in unison uniting hearts and voices as one, we honor Jesus and answer his Jn 17:20-23 prayer–-Make them one!
When we pray the Lord’s Prayer together we join our hearts and voices with the prayers of Jesus and countless Christians past and present.
No prayer is more powerful than praying The Lord’s Prayer together in unison.
Glory be to the Father, & to the Son, & to the Holy Ghost; As it was in the beginning, is now, & ever shall be, World without end. Amen Amen
Greater love has no one than this: to lay down one's life for their friends. John 15:13 https://t.co/ExVUJs4m9A
Be strong in the Lord & his mighty power. Put on all God’s armor so you'll be able to stand firm against the devil. https://t.co/GHr4b4odyn
By this everyone will know you are my disciples, if you love one another. John 13:35 https://t.co/dZlgkWG3EI
You are God: we praise you; You are Lord: we acclaim you; You are Eternal Father: All creation worships you. … https://t.co/9hZwBs1Z5I
Lord, Make me an instrument of your peace! https://t.co/pCvswZCzES
In Christ, God, who is so rich in kindness and grace, purchased our freedom with the blood of His Son and forgave our sins. (Ephesians 1:7)
In Christ I'm chosen before the creation of the world to be holy & blameless in His sight. Because He is Holy, I am holy. Eph 1:4; 1Pet 1:16
In Christ, I am crucified, buried and risen to new life in Him!  It is no longer I who live, but Christ who lives in me! (Galatians 2:20)
Partner with the Holy Spirit to transform your life! Declare back to God in prayer that you are who God’s word declares you to be in Christ!
Gratitude and a grateful heart turns what we have into enough! https://t.co/PqvBI3VgAw
Jesus said I Am the Bread of Life, Light of the World, Sheep Gate, Good Shepherd, True Vine, the Way, Truth & Life… https://t.co/1r0iQAkgqf

Give thanks to the LORD and proclaim his greatness.     
Let the whole world know what he has done.  
 Psa. 105:1 https://t.co/I5p1fK6Vg5
I believe God will do the impossible in my life! https://t.co/15129X6NV2
Keep on asking & you'll receive. Keep on seeking & you'll find. Keep on knocking & the door will be opened to you. https://t.co/MUherg97Fd
There is power in prayer! https://t.co/pi2nmKmwM8
Let your pain drive you to your knees, for there you will find your greatest strength. https://t.co/fE6iHxOTqK
God answers knee-mails! https://t.co/YPnJb8LxtW
If we can take time to carefully craft 140 letter tweets for Twitter, our public prayers deserve the effort to be clear and concise as well!
Listening to God as you write your public prayers makes them more complete & focused & gives you a chance to pray the prayer multiple times.
Spending time with God to fine tune your public prayers for clarity and conciseness will help you avoid sounding preachy or longwinded.
Noting proves that you love someone more than mentioning them in your prayers!
For weddings, funerals & other emotional occasions, take time to listen to God about what he wants you to pray & write it out ahead of time.
You don’t need to stand still with your hands folded & head bowed when you pray. Be free to gesture like you're talking to someone. You are!
When leading in public prayer, invite God to lead your prayers and direct your hearts so your prayers become an act of corporate worship.
In Christ my body is a temple of the Holy Spirit living in me. I'm not my own. I was bought at the price of Christ's sacrifice.1Cor. 6:19-20
In Christ, I am a new creation, a brand new person! Old things have passed away, behold all things have become new!  (2 Corinthians 5:17)
In Jesus Christ, I am now the righteousness of God. I am no longer defined by my sin, because of the cross of Christ! (2 Corinthians 5:21)
In Christ my body is a temple of the Holy Spirit living in me, I'm not my own; I was bought at the price of Christ's sacrifice.1Cor. 6:19-20
Partner with the Holy Spirit to transform your life! Declare back to God in prayer that you're who God’s word declares you to be in Christ!
Praise Jesus, Our Justifier! Since we have been justified by his blood, how much more shall we be saved from God’s condemnation through him!
Praise Jesus, our high priest forever in the order of Melchizedek, who perpetually ministers in the inner sanctuary of Heaven on our behalf!
Praise Jesus Our Great High Priest, who is able to sympathize with our weakness & stands at the right hand of the Father interceding for us!
There is power in the name of Jesus! Learn to pray using each of His names and titles to expand your faith in who He is and what He can do!
RT @bobonfarm: @DailyPrayerLife Take every occasion as an opportunity to pray and not just for yourself but for all of God's creation Let G…
Dare to pray bold public prayers! God is dependable and faithful to his promises. He won’t let you down. He will honor His name before them!
As you pray remind people who our God is & what he’s done for them before so they can remember & trust Him for help in their current crisis!
There are times you'll need to lead public prayers to cry out to God for forgiveness, mercy & rescue. Pray knowing God's heart of compassion
It's not about me.  I'm just one of God's minions. https://t.co/WNgvjZ0fTb
Pray hardest when it is hardest to pray, especially if you are leading the community in prayer during a crisis! https://t.co/wrpCPNsh1p
Pastors, resist the temptation! Don't preach during your prayers. But always listen to God and talk with God while you preach!
When the community is suffering, lead them to run to God for help & deliverance! Don't be afraid of public lament. Take your crisis to God!
When Praying in public, make sure to begin with praise! Be honest. Be clear. Exalt God! Be humble. Sometimes even be a fool for God.
If public emotion is high or tension great write out your words ahead of time & choose your words prayerfully before leading them in prayer.
As you pray if God gives you something to add, verbally acknowledge His direction & thank Him so others learn to listen to God as they pray!
Keep an attentive heart as you lead public prayer & let God direct you! Don't be afraid of brief pauses that allow you to hear God's heart!
Don't be afraid to pray intimately with God in public. When you do you're modeling the kind of relationship God desires to have with us all.
If you're leading others in public prayer, don't be afraid to write out your prayer. That way you get to pray it twice & pray with clarity!
When you pray don't be like the hypocrites who love to pray standing in the synagogues and on street corners to be seen by men. …Matthew 6:5
When leading public prayer, keep ego out of it. It’s not about you and an audience. It’s about exalting God and connecting people with him!
Public prayer isn't about skillfully crafted words. It’s about you connecting with God & using your words & attitude to help others connect!
Amen is Hebrew for YES! May it be so! When we say Amen we reaffirm all we've prayed & commit to act on all God's spoken to us as we prayed!
The Lord's Prayer begins in praise to God, it ends in a doxology giving praise & glory to God. Our prayers should begin & end with praise!
@FikerLeuleseged You're missing 2 important words "with Him." He often gives us more than we can handle on our own so we partner with Him!
In Christ, I will not allow any human authority to stop me from stop telling about everything I have seen and heard Jesus do. Acts 4:19-20
In Christ, I am saved! Salvation is found in no one else! God has given no other name under heaven by which we must be saved!” Acts 4:12
In Christ all God’s promises have been fulfilled with a resounding Yes! & through Christ our Amen ascends to God for his glory! 2 Cor. 1:20
Partner with the Holy Spirit to transform your life! Declare back to God in prayer that you're who God’s word declares you to be in Christ!

When we pray "Deliver us from evil," we ask God to fight for us
in our warfare against Satan whose aim & delight is to disable & destroy us.
When we pray "Deliver us from evil" we're seeking God's help in fighting a powerful & malicious enemy that only God is big enough to defeat.
Jn16:33 I've told you these things, so in me you may have peace. In this world you'll have trouble. But take heart! I've overcome the world!
Romans 12:21 “Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good.”
When we pray "Deliver us from evil," we acknowledge that God must win the battle for us. And Christ has already won the war on the cross!
When we pray "Deliver us from evil," we ask for aid in the spiritual warfare against Satan whose aim & delight is to disable & destroy us.
Praise Jesus the Visible Image of the Invisible God! He existed before anything was created and is Firstborn/Supreme Heir over all creation!
Praise Jesus, Co-Creator and Sustainer of all things! All things were created by Him and for Him, and in Him all things hold together!
Praise Jesus Christ, Lord of All! One day every knee shall bow and every tongue confess that Jesus is Lord to the glory of God the Father!
There is power in the name of Jesus! Learn to pray using each of His names and titles to expand your faith in who He is and what He can do!
When we pray "Lead us not into temptation" we're praying that God will keep us on the narrow path to life free of distractions & diversions.
God always offers forgiveness when we confess our sin but far better to avoid the temptation in the 1st place. "Lead us not into temptation"
When we pray "Deliver us from evil," we’re praying God would overcome the Evil One who’d do anything to mess up our relationship with God.
When we pray "Lead us not into temptation" We're praying that God will keep us on the narrow path to life free of distractions & diversions.
Lead us not into temptation asks for protection from things that might cause us to sin & obstruct/violate our relationship with God & others
When we pray, "Lead us not into temptation,"-- We're asking God to open our eyes to recognize and avoid temptation before we're in its grip.
When we pray, "Lead us not into temptation,"-- We are asking God to keep us away from things that could lead us down a path to sin.
"Forgive us our debts …" We don’t deserve or earn God's forgiveness or mercy by our good behavior, nor should we expect others to earn ours!
To submit to God's mercy is to pledge to also be merciful to others and forgive them just as God has forgiven us and extended mercy to us!
"Forgive us our debts…" When we acknowledge our sin and ask for forgiveness, we recognize that it is out of God’s mercy that He forgives us!
Forgive us our sins as we forgive… is a big part of what it takes to love God and our neighbors and to love one another as Christ loved us.
We're to confess our sins to God & ask for His forgiveness, acknowledging that Christ has covered all of our sins by His death on the cross.
"Forgive us our debts…" –– Forgiveness is an essential starting point of being able to love others with God's kind of love!
"Forgive us our debts…" enables us to fulfill the Great and New Commandments to Love God & others, and love one another as Christ loved us.
@DailyPrayerLife …because we recognize how hard it is for us to let go of offenses.
"Forgive us our sin debt…" recognizes that God is the only one who can help us heal and restore broken or violated relationships!
"Forgive us our sin debt…" seeks to restore proper relationships with God & other people & recognizes we need to partner with God to do it.
The fifth petition of the Lord's Prayer “Forgive our sin and guilt as we forgive those guilty of sinning against us" is the hardest to pray.
God asks us to focus on advancing His kingdom, not on meeting our own basic needs. He promises to meet them. Trust Him. Ask Him daily!Mt6:33
God made us with basic needs to eat, sleep, be clothed & sheltered, & He asks us as His people to trust Him to meet those needs. Mt. 6:19-34
When we pray, "Give us this day our daily bread," we acknowledge that God is the ultimate Provider of all that we have and all that we need!
In Christ no power in heaven above or earth below––indeed nothing in all creation can ever separate us from the love of God in Jesus Christ.
In Christ, I am more than a conqueror through Him Who loves me! (Romans 8:37).
In Christ nothing can separate me from His love––not trouble or hardship or persecution or famine or nakedness or danger or sword. Rom. 8:35
Partner with the Holy Spirit to transform your life! Declare back to God in prayer that you are who God’s word declares you to be in Christ!
@FrancesPasch Thank you for the blessing Cousin France!  May God bless your fruitful ministry of writing as well!
Praise Jesus Our Coming King who will return from Heaven upon clouds of Glory as King of Kings and Lord of Lords to reign forever and ever!
Praise Jesus, the Righteous Judge who will judge the living and the dead with righteousness and equity when he returns to claim his Kingdom!
Praise Jesus, the Son of Man who came not to be served but to serve others and to give his life as a ransom for many!
There is power in the name of Jesus! Learn to pray using each of His names and titles to expand your faith in who He is and what He can do!
@jamescchandler I can't open the link, but I don't recognize the URL as one I have been on.
"Give us this day our daily bread" acknowledges our utter dependence on God to secure our daily needs and sustenance. It's not all up to us.
"And my God will supply all your needs according to his glorious riches in Christ Jesus."  Philippians 4:19
The fourth petition of the Lord's Prayer, "Give us this day our daily bread,” recognizes God as the source of all that we have and need.
Thy will be done says Change the world to the way you desire for it to be. Start with me! This is the practical outworking of God's kingdom.
Prayer is much more about realignment with God than requisition from God.
"Thy will be done on earth as it is in Heaven" is what "Thy kingdom come" looks like when His Kingdom is lived out in all of our lives!
As God's children, we have His DNA written upon our hearts. Loving obedience is a pleasure and a delight as we daily become more like Him!
When we pray “Thy will be done on earth” we're praying for the will of a good and loving Father who desires his best for us & for the world!
Prayer isn't about persuading God but about the submission of our will to God's will, our heart to God's heart, our desires to God's desires

When we pray “Thy will be done on earth as it is in Heaven,” we are aligning our hearts with God's heart and our desires with God's desires!
When we pray “Thy will be done on earth as it is in Heaven,” we are praying for God's plans and purposes to unfold on earth.
We yearn for a time when sin no longer enslaves and dominates our worldly institutions and governments and everyone is set free by Jesus!
We eagerly await the day that every knee should bow in heaven & on earth & under the earth & every tongue confess that Jesus Christ is Lord!
Until Christ returns, His will is done on earth by the Children of God who choose obedience to His will as their Lord & await His return.
In heaven & in eternity, God’s will is instantly & completely done. Jesus asks us to pray that the same will soon be true on earth as well.
Third petition “Thy will be done on earth as it is in Heaven” is the practical outworking of God's kingdom advancing among us on earth.
Christ Jesus who died for us and was raised to life for us pleads for us as He sits in the place of honor at God’s right hand. (Romans 8:34)
In Christ, God has given us right standing with himself and no one dare accuse or condemn us. (Romans 8:33-34a)
In Christ, God is for us, and no one can ever be against us or even accuse us whom God has chosen for his own!  (Romans 8:31-33)
Partner with the Holy Spirit to transform your life! Declare back to God in prayer that you are who God’s word declares you to be in Christ!
When we pray Thy kingdom come, we put our other petitions in proper perspective. Is what I'm asking helping God's kingdom to come on earth?
When we pray "Thy kingdom come," we acknowledge God's sovereignty and express our desire for God's rule to be evident everywhere.
Praise Jesus our Immanuel––God with us! He has promised to never leave or forsake us and to be with us always even to the end of the age!
Praise Jesus the Son of God, who radiates God’s own glory & expresses the very character of God. He sustains everything by his mighty power!
Praise the Lamb of God who takes away the sin of the world! Whose blood has ransomed people of every tribe, language, people and nation!
There is power in the name of Jesus! Learn to pray using each of His names and titles to expand your faith in who He is and what He can do!
When we pray "Thy kingdom come" we are praying in agreement with God's plans and purposes, desiring them to come to pass as God desires!
But until Christ returns, we also pray for His Kingdom on earth to advance as more and more people hear the Gospel and say “YES!” to Jesus!
When we pray "Thy kingdom come" it expresses our desire for Jesus to return to rule & reign! We yearn for His rule to be evident everywhere!
When you pray “Thy Kingdom come,” know that Jesus came to establish the Kingdom of God by his ministry among us and his crucifixion for us!
God show us the holiness of your character & help us to honor & obey you. May all people acknowledge the holiness & lordship of Yahweh God!
HBTN is first and foremost an expression of praise toward God for His Holiness, exclaiming "May your holiness to fill all of the earth!"
“hallowed be Thy name” means "May all people honor, respect and revere you as Holy!" Begin our prayer by praising God for who He is!
First petition “hallowed be Thy name” The first petition of the Lord’s Prayer is actually declarative praise of God, "Your name is Holy!"
As you come to God in prayer, you don't need a mask, your Heavenly Father sees you as you are, his precious child! http://t.co/rNoOmzRuWy
There are times when we can be like friends with God, but never forget that He is God! Respect Him! Honor Him! Never try to boss him around!
In the Lord's Prayer “who art in Heaven” reminds us Our Father is still GOD, so come in reverence with a heart of worship, love & adoration!
"Our Father" means that we can approach the throne room of heaven in prayer assured of his love for us and his intention to bless us!
